meanings.definition: A pin used to secure a timber in place during construction.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter hammered the driftpins into the timber to keep it steady.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to use driftpins to hold the wooden beams together.
meanings.sent3: Why did the nail refuse to work? Because it wanted to be a driftpins instead!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a row of driftpins, holding her dreams firmly in place.
meanings.sent5: The driftpins gleamed in the sunlight, a small but crucial part of the building process.

meanings.definition: A tool used for aligning holes in metal pieces.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used the driftpins to ensure the holes were perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent2: Driftpins are essential for precise work on metal pieces.
meanings.sent3: Why did the drill feel lonely? Because it missed its driftpins companion!
meanings.sent4: His focus was like a set of driftpins, guiding him towards his goal with accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The driftpins clicked into place, creating a seamless alignment of the metal pieces.

meanings.definition: A device used to mark the position of a hole to be drilled.
meanings.sent1: Before drilling, use the driftpins to mark where the holes should be.
meanings.sent2: The driftpins helped the workers identify the exact spots for drilling.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ruler envy the driftpins? Because they always knew where to mark!
meanings.sent4: Her precision was like a set of driftpins, guiding her towards perfection.
meanings.sent5: The driftpins left tiny marks on the surface, indicating where the holes would be drilled.
